place.name: NORTON LINDSEY
place.gazetteerText: NORTON-LINDSEY, or Norton-Superior, a parish, with a village, in the district and county of Warwick.; 1¾ mile E S E of Claverdon r. station, and 3½ W S W of Warwick. Post-town, Claverdon, under Warwick. Acres, 568. Real property, £1, 592. Pop., 157. Houses, 41. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage, annexed to the vicarage of Claverdon, in the diocese of Worcester. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
